event_text: m_c was grabbed by a squidcada, but luckily r_c saved {PRONOUN/m_c/object}! The cub was still left injured from the ordeal.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred as a kit when a squidcada tried to carry {PRONOUN/m_c/object} off.

event_text: r_c dares m_c to try and swim out of camp and m_c can't possibly refuse the challenge. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/do/does}n't make it far, however, before {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} meager swimming skills fail {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} nearly {VERB/m_c/drown/drowns} before an adult spots {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and comes to the rescue.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died of water-inhalation, after trying to swim out of camp.

event_text: r_c dares m_c to try and swim out of camp. m_c can't possibly refuse the challenge, but the water is freezing when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} jump in. Thankfully, an adult notices and scoops {PRONOUN/m_c/object} out, m_c is still shivering violently from the cold.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died after swimming through freezing water when dared by r_c.

event_text: m_c is hopping around in the tide pools when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/trip/trips} and {VERB/m_c/fall/falls} onto the rocks. Thankfully, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} only a bit bruised.
m_c is playing around on the iced-over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and take a tumble.

m_c is clambering around on the platforms when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} and {VERB/m_c/fall/falls}. The moss and plants of the den floor soften {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} landing, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} still sporting some new bruises.
m_c is playing around on the iced-over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and take a tumble.

m_c is playing around on the iced-over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and {VERB/m_c/twist/twists} {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ankle.

m_c found a hole in the wall and, curious as all cubs are, stuck {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} paw inside. The whole camp comes running when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/screech/screeches} in pain. It seems a centipede was living in that hole.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred as a cub when a centipede shocked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
